https://www.universityofcalifornia.edu/n: UC Riverside and Google developed UNITE, an AI model to detect fake videos by analyzing entire video frames, not just faces, improving deepfake detection.
https://news.mit.edu/2025/new-ai-agent-l: MIT's VideoCAD enables an AI agent to learn and operate CAD software from human interactions, converting 2D sketches to 3D models, boosting design productivity.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/08/14/busin: AI data centers' escalating energy demands are driving up electricity costs for consumers and requiring expensive grid upgrades, impacting everyday expenses.
https://www.sciencedaily.com/news/comput: AI-generated videos are becoming dangerously convincing and UC Riverside researchers have teamed up with Google to fight back. Their new system, ...
https://www.nytimes.com/spotlight/artifi: Big Tech's A.I. Data Centers Are Driving Up Electricity Bills for Everyone
https://aimagazine.com/: HelloFresh: How AI is Accelerating Recipe Production
https://www.wired.com/tag/artificial-int: Swatch's New OpenAI-Powered Tool Lets You Design Your Own Watch
https://news.mit.edu/topic/artificial-in: New AI agent learns to use CAD to create 3D objects from sketches.
https://news.gallup.com/poll/654905/amer: Gallup poll revealing that nearly two-thirds of Americans use AI features in everyday products without realizing it.
https://www.pewresearch.org/science/2025: Pew Research Center report on American public opinion regarding AI, highlighting worries about daily use, harm to creativity/relationships, but openness in specific areas.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/29/opini: Opinion piece discussing how even basic AI use can be detrimental to students' fundamental skills like reading comprehension.
https://www.apa.org/topics/artificial-in: American Psychological Association (APA) health advisory on artificial intelligence and adolescent well-being, offering recommendations for safety.
https://menlovc.com/perspective/2025-the: Menlo Ventures report on '2025: The State of Consumer AI' highlights that 61% of American adults have used AI in the past six months, with nearly one in five using it daily, indicating a consumer tipping point and a rapidly growing market.
https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/a: AI boom reshaping daily life as tech giants warn of 'profound risks'. Key themes: ubiquitous integration, democratization of skills, enhanced efficiency. Risks: job displacement, intellectual laziness, profound risks to society. Novel finding: Looming data scarcity for AI training by 2032, and AI-generated data is less effective for training new AIs. Opportunity: AI for AI safety (AI-driven security).
https://hai.stanford.edu/ai-index/2025-a: The 2025 AI Index Report from Stanford HAI details the increasing embedding of AI in everyday life, record private investment, growing public awareness, and emerging efforts in responsible AI and policy/governance.
https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/202: Pew Research Center report on expert and public views regarding the risks, opportunities, and regulation of AI, highlighting differences in excitement, worries, and predictions about AI surpassing human capabilities.
https://www.brookings.edu/articles/how-a: This 2018 Brookings article discusses how AI is transforming various sectors like finance, national security, healthcare, criminal justice, transportation, and smart cities. It also addresses key issues such as data access, algorithmic bias, AI ethics, transparency, and legal liability. While foundational, its publication date means it may not cover the latest advancements.
https://www.norc.org/research/library/wh: Highlights that a significant portion of Americans do not use AI for personal activities, and only a small percentage use it daily, contrasting with general perceptions.
https://safe.ai/ai-risk: CAIS outlines four key risks associated with advanced AI development that could lead to catastrophe: malicious use, AI races, organizational risks, and rogue AI.
https://www.online.uc.edu/blog/artificia: UC Online discusses 9 benefits of AI, highlighting its transformative impact across industries like healthcare, finance, agriculture, and cybersecurity, driving innovation and efficiency.
https://www.pewresearch.org/science/2025: Pew Research Center's report on AI in Americans' lives reveals that one-third of adults under 30 interact with AI multiple times a day, indicating a significant increase in everyday AI integration and public awareness.
https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-rel: U.S. Treasury report on the uses, opportunities, and risks of AI, with a focus on cybersecurity risks in the financial sector.
